alert.note: Alert for Interior York; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 6:54AM EST until January 13 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following areas, in Maine, Central Interior Cumberland. In south central Maine, Coastal Waldo, Interior Waldo, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc and Southern Somerset. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal York and Interior York. * WHEN...Until Noon EST today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen with additional rainfall of up to 1 inch and snowmelt will cause excessive runoff through this morning.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
